chargeHist.descr: Burglary of a Building or Dwelling

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas M McRunnel

records.addlTxt:
8:58 AM Defendant Thomas M McRunnel appeared by video, in custody from the Polk County Jail.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Thomas M McRunnel.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives his right to appear in person for this hearing. The parties have an agreement. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 

This case has $25,206.50 in restitution. Counsel will work on a plan for repayment of restitution and come back to court for a plea hearing.

Parties to contact JA for scheduling.
Status conference on October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:42am Defendant Thomas M McRunnel appeared by video, in custody from the Carroll County Jail.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Thomas M McRunnel.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. There is not an agreement at this time. 

Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. 

Status Conference: 10/20/22 at 9am

9:33 AM Defendant Thomas M McRunnel appeared by video in custody from Polk County Iowa.  Attorney Zebulon Patek not in court.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ARGN: 10/03/22 at 10:20am
Attorneys to contact Branch 4 for rescheduling.

(3:00 PM case called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Prosecuting attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Thomas M McRunnel appeared by video, in custody in the Hennepin County Jail. Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Thomas M McRunnel. 
Parties are ready to proceed.
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and requests to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
State calls Detective Ryan Lambeseder of the Eau Claire Police Department, who is sworn and testifies.
Attorney Patek conducts cross-examination of Detective Lambeseder. Witness excused.
Attorney Patek reserves argument.
Court finds probable cause and binds the case over.
Attorney Patek to schedule an Arraignment with Branch 4 Judicial Assistant.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
(1:55 PM case called.)  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Thomas M McRunnel appeared by video, in custody in Hennepin County without counsel.
Defendant advises still does not have an attorney and is unable to contact the State Public Defender (SPD) Office from the Hennepin County facility.
Court requests the Clerk have the SPD Office contact the defendant and have counsel appointed.
Court finds good cause to extend the time limits for preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:59 PM Defendant Thomas M McRunnel appeared by video, in custody from the Hennepin County Jail.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is looking to retain counsel and needs to apply to the Public Defender's Office. 

Information on this case passed to Attorney Schmitt, who happens to be in the courtroom, to bring to the PD Office. 

Court finds good cause to extend the time limits for a preliminary hearing so that Defendant can find representation.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

(11:17 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Thomas M McRunnel appeared by video in custody in the Anoka County Jail without counsel.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint.
State requests $25,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Defendant advises already on cash bonds for other states and cites reasoning for not needing another cash bond.
Court orders $10,000.00 cash bond with conditions.
Court advises will schedule a preliminary hearing in which the defendant may appear via Zoom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
